title: Ticket #5501: Manual improvement ideas
description:
Ideas for things to add/change in the documentation (create separate tickets for ones we decide to do):
  • User quick-start guide (step-by-step guide to how to run your jobs on an existing HTCondor pool).
  • How to try out HTCondor (guide to setting up a small pool on, say, ~10 machines, maybe w/o root permissions?).
remarks:
2016-Feb-05 10:24:32 by wenger:
Hmm -- now I'm thinking that we should have a whole section of the manual that's something like a "how-to" guide, that would be very task oriented, rather than the reference manual form that most of the documentation is in. Some ideas for subsections of this:

  • How to set up a test pool (start with personal HTCondor on a single machine, expand to 5-10 machines).
  • How to set up a real pool.
  • How to run an HTCondor job (probably just cover vanilla universe; or maybe even start out with scheduler or local to avoid file transfer issues, and then move on to vanilla universe with file transfer).
  • How to use DAGMan.
  • How to set up policies (for several types of policies -- e.g., no preemption, opportunistic, etc.).

I'm thinking that this section should have really detailed recipes/examples that users can follow to get things running with a minimum amount of work.
